nodes.name: Vision
properties: The aspirational description of what the organization wants to achieve in the long-term future
nodes.example: To become the world's most customer-centric company

nodes.name: Mission
properties: The organization's core purpose and focus that normally remains unchanged over time
nodes.example: To organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful

nodes.name: Business Definition
properties: Defines what business the organization is in and who its customers are
nodes.example: We provide cloud computing services to businesses of all sizes

nodes.name: Business Model
properties: Describes how the organization creates, delivers, and captures value
nodes.example: Subscription-based SaaS platform with tiered pricing

nodes.name: Goals and Objectives
properties: Specific, measurable outcomes the organization aims to achieve
nodes.example: Increase market share by 15% within 18 months

edges.description: Business model determines goals and objectives
